meanings.definition: Relating to the study of algae.
meanings.sent1: The scientist conducted a phycological research project on different types of algae.
meanings.sent2: Her phycological expertise helped identify the various species of algae in the pond.
meanings.sent3: The phycological conference was filled with fascinating discussions about algae.
meanings.sent4: His phycological knowledge bloomed like algae in a nutrient-rich environment.
meanings.sent5: Studying algae from a phycological perspective revealed their diverse characteristics.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to seaweed or other aquatic plants.
meanings.sent1: The phycological characteristics of seaweed include its ability to thrive in saltwater.
meanings.sent2: She admired the phycological beauty of the underwater garden filled with seaweed.
meanings.sent3: The chef's phycological experiment with seaweed resulted in a surprisingly tasty dish.
meanings.sent4: The phycological nature of seaweed symbolized resilience in the face of turbulent waters.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the phycological wonders of aquatic plants opened up a new world of discovery.
